page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 20 Sep
t
Though I trust yo
r
L. hath sufficient true
advertisments of
e preparation in
Spaine,
yet uppon a common bruit
at is heere among
marchants, and uppon
e sight of a letter w
ch
was shewed me by
Count Maurice
, I thought it
my duty to certifie yo
r
L.
at
e intelligence
is heere,
at
e
Spanishe King
doth provide excee-
dingly by sea, for
e next sommer: having sent
for out of
Italy
a great nomber of shippes, but
relieng chiefly on his Gallies, of w
ch
he hath great
stoare in a readines at
S
t
Ander
. They are
said to be in greater forwardnes nowe, then
ei
were
e last time. At
D
u
kerke
they are busied
in setting fourthe 14 shippes, to carie all sortes
of munitions, and as many masters and ma-
riners as can be gotten, for Spaine.
We have certaine intelligence,
at
e
D. of Parma
is still at
e Spa, and will continue there till
he have heard from
e Kinge. The discontentm
t
between him and
e Spaniardes doth increase
more and more:
e Duke being fully persuaded,
at he hath bin poisoned by
e Spaniardes pro-
curement.
